item.description:
Come join us for a Labor Day wind down at Down The Hatch on Candlewood Lake. Enjoy a great meal...relaxing waterviews...pleasant conversation... and connect with old friends and new ones! We are having dinner and drinks on the terrace. Hope to see you there!

Down the Hatch is Candlewood Lake's only waterfront restaurant located in Brookfield, CT. Guests come by boat car or sea plane and experience the casual, fun and friendly atmosphere. You will feel like you're on vacation the minute you arrive, see the beautiful views, and grab a cool tasty drink.

Down the Hatch is famous for it's outdoor lakeside dining area, great food, and good times. We also have a formal dining room that is open part of the season which is available for parties and corporate functions.

If you are looking for fun spot with good food, good friends and good times, you've found it. There is always a party at Down the Hatch. See you there...

HATCH HISTORY...

What is known today as Down the Hatch was started in 1946 as a small hot dog stand housing a jukebox and two pinball machines. It was owned and operated by the late Arthur Eberle.

In the early 50’s the original building was converted to four small hotel rooms and became a popular retreat for summer vacationers. A second building was erected with four more hotel rooms to meet the popular demand.In the late 50’s a third building was erected which housed a small kitchen that served guests breakfast, lunch, and a few basic dinner items. An upstairs lounge was added at a later date and the name changed from “The Last Resort” to “The Lake Shore Lounge”.

The facility was purchased in May of 1976 by the Parente family who currently own and operate it. The entire set of buildings underwent several renovations over the years and was finally completed in 1993.

Today it is known as “Down The Hatch Restaurant” serving a complete menu of Steak, Seafood, Burgers and many other tasty combinations daily from 11:30 a.m.
